article.title: ID Experts Awarded Potential $329 Million Contract in Response to OPM Breach
article.text:
Identity Theft Guard Solutions LLC, doing business as ID Experts, Portland, Oregon, is being awarded a $133,263,550 firm-fixed-price contract for commercially available data breach recovery services in response to the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) data breach affecting 21.5 million individuals. Data breach recovery services include credit and identity monitoring services, identity theft insurance, identity restoration services, as well as website services and call center services. These services will be offered to individuals impacted by the OPM background investigation records cyber incident.
This contract includes options which, if exercised, would bring the cumulative value to $329,825,588. Work will be performed in Portland, Oregon and is expected to complete in December 2018 if all options are exercised. Fiscal 2015 operations and maintenance (Navy) funding in the amount of $133,263,550 will be obligated at time of award. Contract funds in the amount of $133,263,550 will expire at the end of the current fiscal year. This contract was competitively procured via the General Services Administration’s electronic request-for-quote system, eBuy, with five offers received. The Naval Sea Systems Command, Washington, D.C., is the contracting activity (N00024-15-F-2123).
